org.imageterrier.termpayload

Class NNTermPayloadCoordinator

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.terrier.structures.TermPayloadCoordinator<int[]>
      • org.imageterrier.termpayload.NNTermPayloadCoordinator

  • public class NNTermPayloadCoordinator
extends TermPayloadCoordinator<int[]>
    Coordinator for storing the term identifiers for the N nearest spatial neighbouring terms of each term occurrence in the index. The neighbour payload is encoded by ordering the list of neighbours and storing the termid deltas using gamma coding.
    Author:
    Jonathon Hare

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description

      The default number of NN terms

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      NNTermPayloadCoordinator()
      Default constructor; uses 15 neighbouring terms.

      Construct the NNTermPayloadCoordinator to use the given number of neighbouring terms.

      • append

        public void append(org.terrier.compression.BitIn postingSource,
          org.terrier.compression.BitOut bos)
            throws IOException
        Description copied from class: TermPayloadCoordinator
        Transfer a single payload from an in-memory source to an on-disk source. The payload will have been previously written to the memory source using TermPayloadCoordinator.writePayloadInMem(MemorySBOS, Object). Typically, in this method you'll read in the payload data from the input and write it to the output directly. Sometimes you might want to modify the encoding/format between memory and disk formats though.
        Specified by:
        append in class TermPayloadCoordinator<int[]>
        Parameters:
        postingSource - the input
        bos - the output
        Throws:
        IOException

      • writePayloadInMem

        public void writePayloadInMem(org.terrier.compression.MemorySBOS docIds,
                     int[] payload)
                       throws IOException
        Description copied from class: TermPayloadCoordinator
        Write a single payload to an in-memory bit-stream. The format that is used to write the payload does not necessarily match the format that will be used to write the index to disk, as it can be changed later by TermPayloadCoordinator.append(BitIn, BitOut).
        Specified by:
        writePayloadInMem in class TermPayloadCoordinator<int[]>
        Parameters:
        docIds - the in-memory stream to write to.
        payload - the payload to write.
        Throws:
        IOException
